jdrasil.sat.encodings

Class BasicCardinalityEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • jdrasil.sat.encodings.BasicCardinalityEncoder

  • public class BasicCardinalityEncoder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides methods to encode cardinality constraints into a formula of propositional logic. Cardinality constraints are constraints of the form At-Most-k (AMK) and At-Least-k (ALK), which force that a certain number of variables in the formula is set to true. Such encodings are commonly used and, therefore, it is important to choose efficient versions of the encoding. The paper "Sat Encodings of the At-Most-k Constraint" from Alan M. Frisch and Paul A. Giannaros provides a nice overview of possible encodings. This class orients itself on this paper.

    • Method Detail

      • binomialAMK

        public static void binomialAMK(Formula phi,
                               java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> variables,
                               int k)
        Add an At-Most-k cardinality constraint for the given set of variables to the formula. This method encodes the constraint using the binomial encoding, which uses n^k new clauses, but does not introduce new variables.
        Parameters:
        phi -
        variables -
        k -

      • binomialALK

        public static void binomialALK(Formula phi,
                               java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> variables,
                               int k)
        Add an At-Least-k cardinality constraint for the given set of variables to the formula. This method encodes the constraint using the binomial At-Most-(n-k) constraint.
        Parameters:
        phi -
        variables -
        k -

      • binaryAMK

        public static void binaryAMK(Formula phi,
                             java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> variables,
                             int k)
        Add an At-Most-k cardinality constraint to the given formula using the binary encoding. This encoding introduce O(kn log n) clauses and O(kn) new variables.
        Parameters:
        phi -
        variables -
        k -

      • binaryALK

        public static void binaryALK(Formula phi,
                             java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> variables,
                             int k)
        Add an At-Least-k cardinality constraint for the given set of variables to the formula. This method encodes the constraint using the binary At-Most-(n-k) constraint.
        Parameters:
        phi -
        variables -
        k -

        public static void sequentialAMK(Formula phi,
                                 java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> variables,
                                 int k)
        Add an At-Most-k cardinality constraint to the given formula using the sequential counter encoding. This encoding introduce O(kn) clauses and O(kn) new variables.
        Parameters:
        phi -
        variables -
        k -
